tip.text: gorgeous leather and paper books, stationary, wrapping paper etc. all made in rome. so beautiful. a definite stop if this is your thing.
hands down best wine bar in rome. the food is outstanding and they know their natural wines. i would fly to rome just to eat and drink here. good music too. next level.
had lunch here & loved it. natural wines by the glass. top quality ingredients. simple roman fare in a classic and low key environment. central location, always busy. a must stop. get the mozzarella.
i want to give a good review as hotel is lovely & staff friendly. but it is so badly managed & understaffed. from the uncleanly spa areas & too late room cleanings to the lack of dining room service.
in need of a good scrub. but the cy twombly exhibition is king. the most comprehensive i've seen. it's on till end of a april. go.

venue.name: Pompidou Centre – National Museum of Modern Art (Centre Pompidou – Musée National d'Art Moderne)

tip.text: ridiculously good. paired down food with perfect flavor. natural wines are top notch. a bit cramped, but it's paris, who cares?
perfection. in everything. from the salads to the sweets. it's mostly take-away. but if you are lucky enough to get a seat at the communal table down below, get it!
this restaurant is perfection. perfect naan, perfect pekora, perfect tandoor. super friendly service too. will be a regular stop on my trips to london.
classic aman resort. service on point, restaurant is good. beautiful place to stay that's 15 min ride from the center of Ubud. aman provides comp driver at call to & fro. room with pool is worth it.
as awesome as any aman in terms of service & experience. however there is an oil storage plant to the right off the beach complete with tankers going by & all. despite that, i'd go back in a minute.
love! saved our disastrous one night in singapore. lively place pushing the boundaries of natural wine in asia. the proprietor is knowledgeable & very friendly. the small plates are worth ordering.
beautiful villa in the heart of canggu. fully staffed with beautiful pool. would stay again. only complaint is they advertise organic garden but there isn't one. so if you only eat organic be warned.
incredible organic food & baked goods. casual & sophisticated, just a few seats. they play sinatra & serve small-producer wines by the glass. gourmet goods & design items for sale too. go often.
beautiful church with perfect acoustics. saw the vienna concert orchestra christmas concert there. amazing! worth returning to vienna just to experience it again! hear music there if you can.
full of beauty & christmas cheer. a small maker craft market & all the food & wine stalls are organic! great food, especially the flatbreads. note: unlike other christmas markets dec 23 is last day.
the coffee is good but the baked goods & sandwiches are not at all special. in this city that's nearly a crime. if you're looking for a next-level treat with your cuppa, make another choice.
interesting, farm-to-table flavors if a bit fussy. great wines, dessert too sweet for us. chef sent coffee & (amazing) biscuits to our table when he heard. they care about quality.
wow! honest farm-to-table focused cooking, great flavors, vibe & architecture. nice selection of natural wines. €100 for 2 - full courses,  a bottle of red & tip. unbelievable value. go often.
the dutch masters, the still lifes, the milkmaid, the architecture, the history. the dutch have such a rich art culture, finely represented here. a must see. it's huge, plan a day, or go back again.
an ok showroom. not the best representation of what company has to offer. better than not at all & decent for a look. best to buy directly from paris showroom when making a serious purchase anyway.
a classic in dutch industrial design. in addition to their lighting, furniture & homeware, the store now includes clothing, and a one room hotel! a must on the amsterdam design route.
genius! a little shop that bakes one thing & bakes it to perfection. open the shop door to the smell of warm chocolate cookies & you can't help but buy. it won't disappoint.
it's sushi in amsterdam, so given that, i would return. the sushi is fresh & tasty. but the best is the warm dishes on the chef's tasting menu. the chef's menu changes monthly. go, & do the 7 course.
only nicaraguans. which are, arguably, better than cubans. gorgeous store with extensive collection & very helpful staff. top quality accoutrements & a stylish smoking lounge below.
as good as any good pizza i've had in europe but not really better. thin crust, quality toppings not overloaded  which is essential. but still, nothing to rave about. tiny little place, pizza only.
cozy & very casual little place for natural wine. not a big selection but well curated. sit at the bar & taste what's open for the day. cheese plate with bread is perfection. nice retro tunes too.
delicious egg dishes & breakfast bowls. made from local, organic & free-range products. a relaxed vibe to enjoy tea or brunch anytime of day. the cakes are amazing, not too sweet. worth going often.
tiny brunch & coffee cafe. quality ingredients & cooking, east mediterranean flavors. focaccia is next level & can be ordered for take home via what's app. special dinner events listed on facebook.
great wine shop focusing on small production, mostly spanish wines, also some french, italian, austrian, german, etc. small but nice saki selection. a fun friday night wine & tapas bar during winter.

formattedAddress: 07817 Sand Jordi de ses Salinas Ibiza

tip.text: organic food. freshly made every day for eat in & take-away. amazing desserts. a great stop for a healthy breakfast or lunch. parking is a pain, best to head to underground parking right next door.
the proprietor james is an expert on natural wines. so many great artisanal organic wines & the tapas is superb. best yet, is the warm & welcoming vibe. a must if you love great wine, or want to.
great local tapas vibe. the real deal. especially fun around the christmas holidiay. go for the cones of fried fish, the olives, and if the burrata stall is there, get it!
gorgeously designed airport. and clean.

venue.name: Adolfo Suárez Madrid-Barajas Airport (MAD) (Aeropuerto Adolfo Suárez Madrid-Barajas)

tip.text: very attentive staff, nice views & great location. the decor not great. definitely not a 5-star hotel.

formattedAddress: C. Marqués de Valdeiglesias, 1 (Esq. Gran Via, 2)

tip.text: could have a couple more choices for vegetarians, especially the dim sum.  but great anyway. take advantage of the condiments, especially the szechuan pepper oil and the fermented broad bean paste.

formattedAddress: The Pier Cathay Pacific Lounge (Gate 65-66 Terminal 1)

tip.text: this is the most beautifully designed room at the pier. loose leaf tea made to order and tea sweets. top quality on all levels.
best business airport lounge ever. the design is gorgeous modern chinese. the noodle bar is awesome. but it's the tea room that takes the cake.  would be considered amazing even if not in an airport.

venue.name: The Pier 玉衡堂 (玉衡堂)

formattedAddress: Departure Level, Terminal 1, Hong Kong International Airport (near Gate 65)
location.address: Departure Level, Terminal 1, Hong Kong International Airport

tip.text: this is the place for organic tomato tapas. nice wine too.
dark & musty. feel is more dated than historical.

contact.facebookName: The Chinnery at Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong

tip.text: amazing japanese. on par with shuko nyc & just as pricey. hard to find as cars can't drive directly to building & brown door is invisible. it's just to the right of the glass door with address above.
swanky atmosphere, loungey house music, and great views.
beautiful spa. get the 90 minute thai herbal compress massage. it's other-worldly.

formattedAddress: กรุงเทพมหานคร
location.state: กรุงเทพมหานคร

tip.text: definitely worth a visit. be prepared for tons of tourist and taking your shoes off before you walk in.

venue.name: Wat Pho (วัดพระเชตุพนวิมลมังคลารามฯ)

location.state: กรุงเทพมหานคร
formattedAddress: 2 Sanam Chai Rd (Maha Rat Rd. & Chetuphon Rd.)
กรุงเทพมหานคร 10200

tip.text: great place for a celebration. the seafood sausage soup is superb. and the mango sticky rice is a can't miss surprise.

location.state: กรุงเทพมหานคร
formattedAddress: กรุงเทพมหานคร 10120

tip.text: worth a stop if you are in the area. and you want a view of the whole of bangkok.

location.state: กรุงเทพมหานคร
formattedAddress: กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110

tip.text: delicious fresh food. the pomelo chili jam & popcorn shrimp was a standout as was the soft-shell crab & whole fried snapper.

location.state: กรุงเทพมหานคร
formattedAddress: กรุงเทพมหานคร 10110

tip.text: beautiful hotel but it's a 40 min. to an hour car ride to most of the places and restaurants of interest. better for a weekend spa getaway than a central point from which to explore bangkok.

formattedAddress: กรุงเทพมหานคร 10300
location.state: กรุงเทพมหานคร

tip.text: very zen like and super clean. one of the better business lounges i've been in. and i've been in a lot.

venue.name: The Bridge - Cathay Pacific Lounge (逸連堂)

tip.text: the decor is a little disney-does-hong-kong but the food wins. the ma po lobster is worth it.

formattedAddress: B/F, Standard Chartered Bank Building, 4-4A Des Voeux Rd C
location.address: B/F, Standard Chartered Bank Building, 4-4A Des Voeux Rd C

tip.text: tasty clean vietnamese food. the grilled mushrooms are a must if you're veg.
the fried grouper is amazing, as is all the food. worth going again and again.
casual, cool atmosphere, quality ingredients and perfect thai flavor. the crispy turmeric squid...get it!
